text:
Hey Eric!

Apologies for the late response.



I hope that your Easter was lovely and safe! 

This is a big ambitious shot that you’re working on! 
Reading through your process, it’s a bit difficult to diagnose the issue over text.

So you have an actor plate A element, a new background plate B, and a CG car that you plan on integrating with plate A and B?

To begin I imagine all of your prep is done correctly - your plate are degrained and tracked. Your character is rotod. Unnecessary plate A elements are cleaned out.

I imagine that your issue is with one of the cameras?
Do you think that it would be easier to work out these technical issues over a video chat or call?

Thanks for the reply. 

My issue now it s render time ... i did some test and animation test too. Tomorrow should be done for the rendering. I did HD 540 rendering denoise with arnold denoise and I will use TVIScale node too upscale at HD 1080. Seems to works fine for the purpose
Roto was more loose for the animation . I ll need to do it accurately next
